an5.178:1.2: Have you ever seen or heard
an5.178:1.3: of a person who has given up killing living creatures,
an5.178:1.4: and then the kings have them arrested for that, and execute, imprison, or banish them, or do what the case requires?”
an5.178:1.7: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.
an5.178:1.10: Rather, the kings are informed of someone’s bad deed:
an5.178:1.11: ‘This person has murdered a man or a woman.’
an5.178:1.12: Then the kings have them arrested for killing, and execute, imprison, or banish them, or do what the case requires.
an5.178:1.13: Have you ever seen or heard of such a case?”
an5.178:1.14: “Sir, we have seen it and heard of it, and we will hear of it again.”
an5.178:2.2: Have you ever seen or heard
an5.178:2.3: of a person who has given up stealing,
an5.178:2.4: and then the kings have them arrested for that …?”
an5.178:2.7: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.
an5.178:2.10: Rather, the kings are informed of someone’s bad deed:
an5.178:2.11: ‘This person took something from a village or wilderness, with the intention to commit theft.’
an5.178:2.12: Then the kings have them arrested for stealing …
an5.178:2.13: Have you ever seen or heard of such a case?”
an5.178:2.14: “Sir, we have seen it and heard of it, and we will hear of it again.”
an5.178:3.2: Have you ever seen or heard
an5.178:3.3: of a person who has given up sexual misconduct,
an5.178:3.4: and then the kings have them arrested for that …?”
an5.178:3.7: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.
an5.178:3.10: Rather, the kings are informed of someone’s bad deed:
an5.178:3.11: ‘This person had sexual relations with women or maidens under someone else’s protection.’
an5.178:3.12: Then the kings have them arrested for that …
an5.178:3.13: Have you ever seen or heard of such a case?”
an5.178:3.14: “Sir, we have seen it and heard of it, and we will hear of it again.”
an5.178:4.2: Have you ever seen or heard
an5.178:4.3: of a person who has given up lying,
an5.178:4.4: and then the kings have them arrested for that …?”
an5.178:4.7: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.
an5.178:4.10: Rather, the kings are informed of someone’s bad deed:
an5.178:4.11: ‘This person has ruined a householder or householder’s child by lying.’
an5.178:4.12: Then the kings have them arrested for that …
an5.178:4.13: Have you ever seen or heard of such a case?”
an5.178:4.14: “Sir, we have seen it and heard of it, and we will hear of it again.”
an5.178:5.2: Have you ever seen or heard
an5.178:5.3: of a person who has given up alcoholic drinks that cause negligence,
an5.178:5.4: and then the kings have them arrested for that, and execute, imprison, or banish them, or do what the case requires?”
an5.178:5.7: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.
an5.178:5.10: Rather, the kings are informed of someone’s bad deed:
an5.178:5.11: ‘While under the influence of alcoholic drinks that cause negligence, this person murdered a woman or a man.
an5.178:5.12: Or they stole something from a village or wilderness.
an5.178:5.13: Or they had sexual relations with women or maidens under someone else’s protection.
an5.178:5.14: Or they ruined a householder or householder’s child by lying.’
an5.178:5.15: Then the kings have them arrested for being under the influence of alcoholic drinks that cause negligence, and execute, imprison, or banish them, or do what the case requires.
an5.178:5.16: Have you ever seen or heard of such a case?”
an5.178:5.17: “Sir, we have seen it and heard of it, and we will hear of it again.”
